State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: Nero’s ill-fated empress Poppaea appears on certain provincial issues but she is absent on the imperial coinage. Possibly the emperor was wary of sharing such honours after dispatching his ambitious mother, Agrippina II.
Bibliographic references: BMC Greek (Alexandria) / Catalogue of the coins of Alexandria and the Nomes (2669, p.?)
PCR / Principal coins of the Romans: Volume I: The Republic c. 290 - 31 BC; Volume II: The Principate 31 BC - AD 296; Volume III: The Dominate AD 294 - 498. (416A)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Poppaea Sabina
